Downloading data from recount

2018-09-27

Source: vignettes/get_recount_data.Rmd
get_recount_data.Rmd

Preprocessing data from the recount database

Here we will download a study of human vaccination responses in which individual cell types were sorted out from PBMCs.

source(system.file("dl_recount.R", 
                   package = "clustifyR"))

pbmc_data <- dl_recount("SRP051688")

pbmc_data$read_counts[1:5, 1:5]
##          SRR1740034 SRR1740035 SRR1740036 SRR1740037 SRR1740038
## A1BG            317        369        319        273        148
## A1BG-AS1        421        442        405        409        109
## A1CF              3          8          6          5          1
## A2M               3          5          1          6         21
## A2M-AS1           2          0          3          3         21
pbmc_data$meta_data[1:5, ]
## # A tibble: 5 x 5
##   run        time  `cell type`              assay   donor      
##   <chr>      <chr> <chr>                    <chr>   <chr>      
## 1 SRR1740034 0 d   primary human B cells    RNA-seq Donor: HD30
## 2 SRR1740035 1 d   primary human B cells    RNA-seq Donor: HD30
## 3 SRR1740036 3 d   primary human B cells    RNA-seq Donor: HD30
## 4 SRR1740037 7 d   primary human B cells    RNA-seq Donor: HD30
## 5 SRR1740038 0 d   primary human myeloid DC RNA-seq Donor: HD30

Next, we’ll select the time = 0 controls.

good_libs <- filter(pbmc_data$meta_data, str_detect(time, "0"))

pbmc_data <- pbmc_data$read_counts[, good_libs$run]

Lastly, we’ll rename the columns based on the cell type.

new_ids <- left_join(data_frame(run = colnames(pbmc_data)), 
          good_libs, by = "run") %>% 
  group_by(`cell type`) %>% 
  mutate(cell_id = stringr::str_c(`cell type`, " rep ", row_number())) %>% 
  pull(cell_id)

colnames(pbmc_data) <- new_ids

pbmc_data[1:5, 1:5]
##          primary human B cells rep 1 primary human myeloid DC rep 1
## A1BG                             317                            148
## A1BG-AS1                         421                            109
## A1CF                               3                              1
## A2M                                3                             21
## A2M-AS1                            2                             21
##          primary human monocytes rep 1 primary human neutrophils rep 1
## A1BG                               249                               3
## A1BG-AS1                           219                               2
## A1CF                                 0                               0
## A2M                                 31                               0
## A2M-AS1                             56                               0
##          primary human NK cells rep 1
## A1BG                               73
## A1BG-AS1                           96
## A1CF                                1
## A2M                               184
## A2M-AS1                            73
